Ratings.comment: This class was fairly easy, but not because there was no work. For covering so much, it was remarkably well laid out. Prof. Knodel is very engaging and does her best to make sure everyone understands the content. It's not graded harshly, but you have to put in the legwork to really grasp the material (probably goes for any intro language class).

Dr. Knodel was an amazing professor. She did an amazing job teaching a complicated subject. She ensures that students are all learning the information and is willing to work with you if something is going awry.

Dr. Brown is one of the most caring professors I have ever had. He puts in so much time for his students and deeply cares about everyone that comes into his classroom. His class isn't an easy A and you have to put in the work to understand the language, but overall Professor Brown is an amazing man.

If you genuinely want to learn to speak Greek well, Dr. Brown's Modern Greek courses are a great choice. However, if you're just taking the class for credit or aren't serious about mastering Greek, these courses may not be for you. They require hard work, but Dr. Brown is one of the most genuine and caring instructors you'll meet.

I went into his class with a solid knowledge of the subject matter and prior experience with the readings, and he blew me out of the water at first. You get to class, and he just talks and talks, then expects you to take notes on his rambles. Then will give a very specific quiz. It was difficult and particular and the class I learned the most from.

the professor was really chill. we readings for every class and pop quizzes for most of them. however, i actually dont know if it went towards my grade. i actually dont know how i got graded in the class. i dont have a single grade in carmen but got an A.
Cares about students more than any professor I've had at OSU

Not much Greek is spoken in class. Its all memorization and random calling on students to answer, without really confirming that you understand. He also makes it clear that he only teaches academic level Greek and talks badly about Greeks that use slang or a lower form of the language. I would not recommend

Prof. Brown was a great professer. I truly learned a lot of Greek in his class and would 100% have him as a teacher again. He was really easy and gave many quizzes on material we covered in class the day before. He reviews the quiz material before the quiz to ensure everyone passes. A great man, and loves his students.

I have Professor Brown for his Greek language classes and let me tell you, never before have I seen Professor develop such a great working relationship with his entire class. Very much so in tune with the needs of the class as well as the Greek culture. While the class is often disorganized, you can feel yourself learning a ton.

lectures were insanely disorganized; i wrote a few key points down&sometimes paid attention but passed with an A! He has readings for you to complete before each class (all online, no textbook req.) and i almost never read any of it (just check main topic). He gives you the questions for the midtermfinal as a study guide&answers them in class!

this class was DEFINITELY not an easy GE. Although i did get an A, the amount of work for this 3cr hr class was unbelieveable. Pop quizzes over insanely long readings, and a giant 10page research paper. There were also exams, which involved around 9+ essay responses.... The content was very interesting, but was a lot of time. He was a little creepy

EXTREMELY disorganized class. No structure to lectures. Lots of readinglong Greek movies. Long essay exams, however he graded them easily. 10 page paper due at the end of the semester. Attendance required, quizzes about the reading at the beginning of every class. Overall, I would not recommend this class.

Ugh I love him. He's so passionate about the subject and his lectures are super entertaining. There are weekly quizzes, two midterms and a final, but they are all online. He is super nice and easy to reach through email.

Passionate, caring guy with cool modern connections to Greek myths. Beware of quizzes: they're open-note but VERY specific with Few questions (you only have one attempt at each). The emphasis on details detracts from learning the big takeaways. Lectures not required but slides aren't comprehensive (his riffs are fun anyways)! Take thorough notes.

This was my favorite class of the semester. You can tell Professor Hawkins really cares, and he is extremely knowledgable about his information. I found his lectures very interesting but it is important to pay attention because the only graded material in this class are 10 quizzes. The quizzes are difficult if you do not understand the material.

Professor Hawkins is a passionate guy about mythology and the lecture he teaches. The weekly quizzes are open noted but are a little difficult. Outside of class, he is a genuine guy and care about the students. Really good class and many takeaways!

His lectures are very engaging and interesting when it comes to the content. The problem is the weekly quizzes. The quizzes will have the most specific details for the questions, and they're only 10 pts so missing one question is detrimental. I should not have a higher grade in Gen Chem 1 than I do in this class especially since this is a GE class.

Mr. Hawkins is super entertaining and makes learning about greek mythology fun and easy to understand. Weekly multiple choice online quizzes that aren't too bad. The only issue I have is sometimes the quiz questions are wrong or vague, but other than that probably one of my favorite classes

Quizzes had the most absurd answers down to the most minute details. Slides and lectures did not help, and quizzes would take over an hour to find all the tiny details. Only had 1 attempt at quizzes as well, while other professors taking the same class gave unlimited attempts. Should not be like this for a GE that is supposed to bring grade up.

He's a genuinely good guy who's passionate about what he teaches. His exams, however, are very tough and ask questions on the most minute little details. You think you're prepared and then it asks a question about something you've never even heard of in class. Tests cover a TON of material. Be ready to study more than you have for any GE class.

Cool guy. I was in the first semester where you didn't have to write a single paper. Your whole grade was 1 quiz per week (online), one midterm (online), and one final (online). I went to 2 classes and worked in a study group with my friends and passed with flying colors. Great guy though, so try to go to his lecture. He loves what he does.

This class was very enjoyable. Had assigned readings each week and lecture was review of the readings. Had weekly quizzes that were untimed, midterm, and final that were all online. Attendance isnt mandatory but I found it very helpful as sometimes the myth readings can be a little confusing. Overall easy & interesting class. Tons of extra credit!

100% of lecture was a waste of time. The readings were long and hard; there is plenty of supplemental material on websites like spark notes. He absolutely never lectured to what was on the tests or quizzes. This class IS easy if you can do 40 pages a week, however, the prof is unnecessary. You are on your own which is not a bad thing.

Class is really easy and enjoyable. Quizzes had unlimited attempts to get a 100 and have 3 essays that were 2 pages double spaced. The lecture is more of a discussion of the reading. Dont expect real notes. Have to read the assigned myths. Everything online.

Easy honors GE, decent amount of reading but you can definitely skim or sparknote. No tests, quizzes on the myths and discussions, 3 projects that you get to pick from a list of 6-7. Hawkins is an engaging, interesting guy  but class dragged on just because there isn't a ton to discuss with the subject matter.

Ugh I love him. He's so passionate about the subject and his lectures are super entertaining. There are weekly quizzes, two midterms and a final, but they are all online. He is super nice and easy to reach through email.

I found his lectures very interesting but it is important to pay attention because the only graded material in this class are 10 quizzes. The quizzes are difficult if you do not understand the material.

If you want an A, you can get one. Professor Knodel cares if you learn the material and gives you opportunities to correct your mistakes.

Dr. Knodel is the goat! Extra credit, retakes for quizzes, test corrections. Makes it feel like you can actually learn the latin as opposed to hitting a checklist for a grade like in some other classes. Genuinely cares about her work + the students involved

The content was very interesting, but was a lot of time. He was a little creepy

EXTREMELY disorganized class. No structure to lectures. Lots of readinglong Greek movies. Long essay exams, however he graded them easily. 10 page paper due at the end of the semester. Attendance required, quizzes about the reading at the beginning of every class. Overall, I would not recommend this class.

FIREEE FITS!!!!!! If I'm being completely honest, his lectures were incredibly funny, and to continue with the honesty, this man was always late to lecture. Not that I minded, but it was just hilarious how he was always late. He's incredibly understanding and honest with his students. He's a nice professor. Take him if you can!!!!!! Easy A (:
My favorite professor!
My favorate Professor!

This class in unbelievably easy. You don't even have to do the readings in order to succeed in this class. And for each quiz, you get two attempts. She is very clear with how she wants you to answer the written response questions for the tests and gives examples. Very easy A.

The course was pretty easy. There was one 10 pt quiz every week and then a test every 5 weeks. It's mostly multiple choice with a few written response on the test but she is very direct with what she wants for the written response.

Great professor. I would highly recommend you take this class. Only advice would be to pay attention in class. Exams are not really hard. Write your essays before the deadline and send it to the TA, so you can maximize your grade.
Easiest online class I've taken at OSU. If you want an easy GE and are at least mildly interested in Greek mythology, take this one.

I took this online class for a GE requirement and it was very manageable. There are weekly lectures, readings, and quizzes(open note). I never did any of the readings and did just fine. Each test has 28 questions from previous quizzes(mult-choice), and 4 written questions(5-10 sentences). Study guide for each test and the final is NOT cumulative!!!
Pretty good professor. class was easy with a quiz every week and 3 tests. The only annoying thing is each quiz and test require a password  and you have to watch the lectures in order to get them.

Online lectures each week for 2 hrs. Some outside reading. Keep an outline of what you read and obtain summaries for each. Typed notes helped with recalling for weekly open note quizzes. Study for the exams by making quizlet notecards from the quizzes and reviewing the tests.
Dr. But is incredibly knowledgeable in her field. She makes thoughtful connections outside the course material and provides a great learning experience.

Fertik brings a lot of energy to her lectures, and you can tell she enjoys what she teaches. There was a good amount of reading outside of class (2 books), but it isn't extremely important, just make sure you attend lectures and take notes. The class can sometimes be boring, but it's an easy A if you just pay attention and attend.

Super passionate professor which was quite refreshing. She does assign a lot of reading but you don't necessarily need to do it. Just show up to lecture and pay attention and you'll do fine on her exams. She also assigned three short papers as well, which she graded very leniently.
Def take him more for his lectures than any class work.

Dr. Al-Jallad is the best professor I've had. He's intelligent and extremely passionate about his field, with an infectious enthusiasm that makes lectures lively and interesting. You can get away with skipping some readings, although you'll probably be hooked enough to explore them on your own. Don't worry about the grades; enjoy the experience.

Professor Al-Jallad is one of the most passionate professors whose passion is undoubtedly matched by their mastery of the subject. Lectures are thought-provoking and easy to follow. He's more concerned with making students just as fascinated he is than he is with assignments. Generous feedback and available for office hours with tea! Take him!

Best professor and best class at OSU by a million. Every class had very very high-level discussions which I could honestly never get anywhere. OSU needs to cherish Ahmad and this class and publicize it a lot more because I believe every Muslim or anyone interested in Islam NEEDS to take this course. He is a very light grader and very personable.

This course is asynchronous, so rather than "lectures" there are slides and required readings on mythology. The slides are well made and the required readings aren't too bad. Quizzes are straightforward and non-tricky, exams repeat quiz questions, discussion posts are fun since mythology is a very cool subject.

Prof. Garber's online class was very well organized. She is really smart and good at explaining things. The class is easy with exam questions that are copied from the weekly quizzes. Low maintenance and also kind of interesting. Garber is cool and approachable.

This is definitely one of the easiest gen eds to take. Lectures are intresting and informative.
There are 3 exams made up entirely of questions you had on quizzes throughout the semster.

Easiest class I've ever taken, lectures are actually interesting but to be honest you don't have to attend a single one to get an A in the class. Weekly quizzes are free 100s and the test use the same questions as the quizzes.
I took this class to fulfill my last GE, and it was an easy A. Very little effort is needed to succeed in this class. Professor is accessible outside of class.

The professor was very informative during lectures, which tied in well with the course material; this allowed for the opportunity to think deeper. Literature is admittedly far from being my forte, but this was a course well worth taking.
Took her async class. This is one of the easiest gen eds to take. Would recommend for anyone looking for an easy A.

Dr. Gaber's class is a very good GE to take. She is a good lecturer, and you will do well if you put in the effort to read most of the material and attend class. She hits key points for understanding during lecture, and her tests are not bad at all. Overall the class was fun and interesting.

I took greek mythology online with Gaber, the class met Mon/Wed/Fri on zoom, but she posts recordings of the lectures on Carmen. There are weekly quizzes that mostly cover the lecture material and the larger exams are composed of questions from the same pool as the quizzes. Gaber is very personable, even the zoom lectures are worth attending!

Took Classics1101 last semester and enjoyed all the literature we read, her lectures really add to the material and make it more engaging to read the longer novels and works. Exams followed the quizzes pretty closely and she always made sure to offer alternative options for other big grades like the seminar/discussions since the class was online.
Professor Gaber's lectures were clear and the slides she prepared to go with them were awesome! Easy grader but you have to read the material.

Amazing professor and lecturer. Took her class for easy gen ed credits and left the class wanting to learn more! Super knowledgeable and thoroughly interested in what she teaches. She knows some of us cant read a lot for hw so assigns accordingly too! Really interesting lectures and topics, while keeping workload small! Would recommend for all!

If you are looking for an interesting and easy gen ed, take her class! She is very understanding when it comes to deadlines and understands that most people take the class for GE credit. There are open note quizzes every week and you have two attempts at them, easy As. The exams are easy as well. Watch the lectures and you will do well. Loved it.

This class was a good gen ed class. there are weekly quizzes you get 2 attempts at which are pretty easy. the tests had multiple choice questions from previous quizzes which was nice, but the writing part was kind of hard and it was easy to run out of time. as long as you watch lectures/know what's going on you'll be fine

Professor Gaber is great! You get two attempts on the weekly quiz and have three easy unit exams. She posts a practice exam before each exam and uses the same questions on both so you know exactly what she is asking you. She also lets you do a short writing assessment instead of a socratic seminar if you don't like talking in class.

Professor Gaber is awesome. Their lectures are always do a great job of covering the material. If you have even a little bit of knowledge in Ancient Greco-Roman literature, you are all set for this class. All the texts are very palatable, and you get multiple chances on the quizzes. Even if you put in minimal effort, you will easily pass.

Professor Gaber was a solid instructor for a gen-ed. There were weekly online quizzes which allowed for two attempts and should be an easy 100%. There were three exams (noncumulative) covering different poems we were supposed to read for class. I personally did not read any of the content and I still did fine.

Dr. Gaber is one of the best professors, especially during the pandemic. She was always available, a fast replier via email, and was always helpful when struggling. The class had 5 longer (the more detailed the better) weekly response questions, a quiz every other week, 5 character sheets, and 1 final exam. If you put in the work, you will get an A

Gaber is a great professor. The workload consists of a couple of readings with 10 reading questions and a quiz once a week. Also, there are a couple of exams throughout the year that were open book for us. As long as you do the work and go to class, you will get an A.

Gaber is an amazing professor. I cant recommend her enough. She wants her students to learn and fall in love with her passion, and it shows. She requests class participation, but no one is penalized for not participating. I took this class for a GE & I am very glad I did. I plan to ask what other classes she teaches. Work load is extremely easy.

Professor Johnston was my favorite professor I had this semester. Attendance wasn't mandatory and she post class note outlines for every class. There was no textbook, she provided PDFs of everything she wanted us to read. Quizzes were lecture content and were substituted for class to make sure students had time to complete the quiz.

Proffesor Johnston gave interesting lectures and I learned a ton without the stress of grades. There were several short writing assignments which she gave great feedback on and even let you rewrite and be re-graded. The two "midterms" were very reasonable short multiple choice quizzes, she doesn't try to trick you. Highly recommend this class!

The class consists of going to lecture to take notes and then there's multiple writing assignments. The writing assignments are small though and fairly easy to write. There were only two "exams" and they were both multiple choice. I highly recommend taking this class. Professor Johnston is also very funny and truly cares for her students!
Lectures with stories so you remember them better. As long as you show up and put any percent of effort into listening you'll do well. Quizzes are easy and not too specific.

Super easy class, I got a 99.75%. If you show up to lecture and pay attention (maybe take a sentence or two of notes), the quizzes are 100's. Her grading consisted of a quiz at the end of each week, a midterm, and a final. No writing, minimal reading despite being a literature course.

The class was graded based on 5 quizzes and a final. All the quizzes seemed to be a little difficult, but doable. Attendance is required and made up something like 30% of the grade, so if you take this class you better plan on attending. The lectures are very interesting if you like magic or witchcraft and the course content is very solid.

Professor Iles-Johnston was extremely knowledgable in her field and was able to answer even the most specific hypotheticals. She is clearly passionate about her subjects (I took her Witchcraft class) and uses that passion to engage students. very easy to talk to, very quirky woman. I would definitely take another class of her's!

This class was interesting, and there were a couple times where movies were shown during lecture. You take notes every lecture from an outline that she posts on Carmen. Be sure to pay attention during lecture to take good notes so that you can prepare well for quizzes and the final.
Really funny, informative, easy quizzes, showing up matters.

My favorite professor hands down. Sit in the front row. Participate. If you like listening to stories you will love this class. Johnston is a wonderful caring professor (which is rare). Put in some effort for the papers and reread your notes for quizzes. I finished with an 104% in the class. Do not skip class though, you might get behind!

Great professor and incredibly easy class. 4 short quizzes, 3 short papers, and attendance are only grades. No reason not to receive an A as long as you go to class. Definitely cares about her students and the subject. Would recommend to anyone.

Super interesting class! 10% attendance and 90% is distributed between 5 quizzes, so there's no final which is sweet! Not super hard, DO NOT BUY THE BOOK it's not worth it. Very lecture heavy, she gives outlines of notes but adds a lot more in class so you have to pay attention. If you go to lecture and do the notes it's a pretty easy A!

Professor Johnston has honestly been one of my favorite professors at OSU. She did a fantastic job of summarizing our readings and always kept the class engaged and interested. I took her class to satisfy a GE and it was very straightforward; the final grade consisted of 2 quizzes (20% each), attendance (15%) and a final paper (45%). Easy A.

This class was interesting and the professor worked hard to keep everyone engaged with pictures, movie clips and anecdotes along with the lecture. You can read the textbook, I never did and still got As on all the quizzes. Graded only on multiple choice quizzes and a multiple choice final. Attendance is taken and graded, so show up.

Dr. Johnston was a great professor.  While lectures could be boring she kept them interesting.  If you go to every class and pay attention the class is an Easy "A".  The class consist of 5 quizzes and 1 final.  There is no homework except for reading.

She's very friendly and teaches with a lot of enthusiasm.  The only reason I didn't like this class is because there are 5 quizzes (lowest dropped), attendance, and the final. The quizzes and final only has 20 questions, so it's pretty easy to kind of poorly in the class.

She is honestly the best professor in all the classes I have ever taken here for the past 3 years. She is clear and goes in details on everything. Read the materials she gives and you will have no problem. I would take her class all over again!

Such an easy GEC. Took notes through an outline she put on Carmen and quizzes were based off of that. Each quiz was 20 questions and the lowest dropped and the final was 20 questions basically full of questions off of the old quizzes. Very interesting class. Watched a movie and very clear and helpful if you had questions.

I thoroughly enjoyed the class. Professor Johnston clearly enjoyed what she was teaching, and we took notes via outline form, which I found very easy. If you pay attention, the class is very interesting and easy!
she worked for history channel. she knows the subject
She's very interesting and an expert in her field. She's funny, charming and just fun to listen to.
She's super nice and super funny. 4 quizzes and a really easy essay for midterm and final. Easy A.
Amazing Professor. She really knew what she was talking about and really liked to help. 10 quizes and a final paper. Super easy.

Johnston was very helpful by thoroughly explaining the course contain each day of lecture. The quizzes were not difficult as long as you listened during lecture and read the provided outline each day.

She was always prepared and sprightly. She seemed like she loved her job and loved undergrads. Her assignments were interesting and easy to complete, and her story-telling abilities are spectacular. The class was not as much fun as I had hoped it would be--but I still got a lot out of it.
Johnston is a great teacher who is very clear about her expectations. Her lectures are clear and organized and she is very knowledgeable about the subject matter.

Easy class! If you need a GEC, definetly take this one with sarah! It's like storytime everytime, and she keeps it interesting! Only 5 quizes, drops lowest one..my lowest was only 27/30.  If you go to class and listen, you'll know the answers to the quizes!! Don't need to read either, as long as you don't skip class, your fine!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

I enjoyed her lecture. It was a very intresting class. If you go to lecture you just need to review her notes when you study. She gave a lot of cool information. Her quizzes were multiple choice and if you study some then they are easy! I enjoyed the material she covered, she kept the class interesting.

She's a wonderful teacher.  She kept class pretty interesting, and the outlines she put online before class were very helpful.  Tests and final were very easy multiple choice.  I actually looked forward to going to class - it was like storytime!  Definitely recommended.

I've taken three classes with her, Classics 222, Greek Religion and an MRS class, Witchcraft and Magic in the Middle Ages.  I can highly recommend any class by her.  I got A's in all but the last class, and that was because I slacked that quarter. And, not only did I get good grades, I learned a lot of interesting stuff.  Don't slack, go to lecture

Very easy, fun class. Books aren't really necessary but can be fun to read if you're into Greek myth. Listening to a story or two every day and remembering who did what isn't very hard if you try. I especially liked her style of giving outlines ahead of time, that way you don't struggle to keep up.
GREAT PROF! Very interesting teaching methods, kept class very lively.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Kept most of the lectures interesting - it was more like hearing a story everyday. Don't buy the books though, I spent $108 bucks and only read them the first week. Went to lectures and took notes and had an A- (missed an A by 2 pts.)
Really easy class, only based on 150 points, keeps lectures lively and interesting.

Professor Bourgeois is so incredibly knowledgeable about his stuff that you'll spend the first few lectures unraveling the ramblings of a madman. However, the course is structured well enough (and he's a good enough lecturer) that you'll be able to discuss the nuances of said ramblings by the end of the semester.

Prof. Bourgeois was awesome. In my 1st semester in TO, I was super nervous and was initially put off by his heavy reading list. However, everything we read (and later discussed in class) was so engaging and thought-provoking that the time spent on it didn't matter. Take him if you're given the choice!

The class was basically just a reading/discussion of various Latin texts, and Brandon made it pretty straightforward and engaging, for the most part. Lectures were important since he delineated what to understand from each text, and he was very generous in his assessments and overall grading. At times, class got a bit stale, but overall good!

Don't do it. Just don't. Signed up for this class at USC because it was the only GESM that fit in my schedule with open seats. Enjoyed it at first, but over time it became clear that he is very arrogant, pretentious, and expects way too much of college freshman in a GE. He tears apart your work and made my entire class feel inadequate.

He is a great professor and for an upper division class it is pretty easy. He loves the subject and is more worried about learning then grades. I would highly recommend this class he truly cares about roman law- don't let the course description scare you. Would recommend - just read and engage in lecture!

Clearly cares deeply about the subject, has a really cool rap of the Iliad. Grades are not difficult. Would highly recommend this class. I found that he responded to my emails within 24 hours, lectures were heavy on getting people involved, and lectures can be engaging if you do the reading!
Easy GE but Brandon is uncooperative, difficult to reach by email etc. Lecture isn't necessary and he just uses it to hear himself talk. Take this class with any one else.

Eeasiest class I will ever take at Ohio State. I went to 3 classes all year and managed to get a high A. There were 12 online quizzes 10 points each that you had 2 attempts at. you could use your notes too. Also 2 writings that took 10 minutes each and were graded very easily. No Midterm and if you get higher than 90% on quizzes then no final.

Brandon makes his lectures interesting. This class is not difficult, easy 1 page papers and weekly 10 question online quizzes. He rapped the Intro to the Iliad which was awesome. Overall, it's an easy class and Brandon makes it interesting. I would definitely take this class!

Brandon said from the start that he doesn't care about grades and only gives grades because he has to. There were no exams, the papers are 1 page max, all quizzes are 10 easy questions online, and classes are just discussion. I found him really easy to talk to and always helpful. Definitely recommend to take as a GE.

Such an interesting class. Every day I learned something new!! Didn't take too much time to do the work either. There were discussion boards and small open-note weekly quizzes, but it really wasn't bad. She genuinely cares about our success and I highly recommend the class.

Prof. Hawkins clearly loves what she teaches and that enthusiasm definitely gave me a new appreciation for Ovid's Metamorphoses. I would highly recommend taking a Latin class with her. She is very understanding in terms of absences, but be ready to translate and put in the work during classes!
Classes are pretty boring unless you're really into the material. Fairly easy exams and quizzes.

Professor Hawkins does her best to make course material for kids in other majors, this results in terribly anachronistic comparisons of the ancient romans to the modern day. Class is like attending the Democratic National Convention-Donald Trump was mentioned in every single class, an incredible feat noting that he was not alive during Ancient Rome

The first 9 weeks covers basically nothing but hearsay that she will say is supported by "sources," though none can be found. Second half is a bit more substantiated, but it is hard to get over the infused ideology ever-present. She loves to cover how much she hates republicans. Don't speak up if you have different political beliefs.
Exams are open notes. One paper towards the end. Super kind and caring. Two discussions per week and a quiz at the end of the week. Really easy A. Take this class!

Class was relatively easy. I showed up to every lecture and thats all I needed to do to get a 90% on the midterm and final. Professor is very well versed on the topic but often goes into too much detail. There are readings but I never did them because she talks about the main points in class. Overall solid GE and I took away more than I expected.

Shes pretty unorganized as far as a syllabus, using Carmen, and rubric criteria. You get graded on a few quizzes, a midterm, a final, and a term paper. The class is easy if you can endure the long lectures that, again, are not super organized. If you can know the key terms and find the important information in the crazy slides youll be ok.

If you're interested in the subject, I'm sure she's great. if you're just there for an easy A, lectures are boring as can be but just show up and take good notes and you will be ready for exams which aren't too difficult.

She is one of the nicest professors I have ever had, and you can tell she loves the subject, but I did find the material quite boring. I can see how some people would be very interested in it though.  Everything is fairly easy, and she provides lots of EC, but it was very lecture heavy, and her powerpoint were all over the place.

Dr. Hawkins is a fantastic lecturer. I truly  am enjoying this intro Roman Civ class. Dr. Hawkins is truly enjoyable to listen to, she LOVES questions, and is very passionate about her material. Attendence is taken daily and does count. Quizzes every Friday but are super easy if you just follow the lecture. Would definitely take again!!

one of the most passionate professors i have had, however she is all over the place with her teaching and although she was interested in the class i found it hard to pay attention or care about what i was learning. exams weren't too bad but there weren't many grades for wiggle room.
Easy GE. Loves discussion, cool professor.
She is a little all over the place when she teaches, but if you listen to her you will get an easy A in the class. You don't even have to read. Just show up and listen.

I think Julia did a good job. People need to chill because she brought her kids to class when they didn't have school and her husband was at work. She's an amazing teacher and very helpful. Just pay attention and read and you'll be fine. The topics were very interesting and the tests/essays were fairly easy if you knew the material.

I learned so much in this class and I had no idea ancient medicine had so much to do with modern medicine.  I now am thinking about minoring in the medical humanities minor!  I hope the other classes in the minor are this interesting
Great Class; topics focus on the big picture. Helpful in preparing for med-school interviews!

would recommend this class to anyone looking for an easy A.  I dont own the book and dont pay attention during lecture but it is fairly easy material.  Hawkins does take some time to grade, but that is because she is mainly doing the load of the grading herself.  Very approachable and passionate.

Would not recommend this class. The material is somewhat interesting if you get into it, but since this is just a GE, I wasn't very into it. She brings her kids to class sometimes and takes forever to get grades back. Does cancel classes and quizzes sometimes. If you go to class, which is part of your grade, you won't have to do much reading.

I would not recommend this class. She brought her children to class 3 times so far this semester. One time was during our exam and she kept clapping at the kids to be quiet at the front of the room, which was very distracting. Three weeks after the exam, which is 35% of your overall grade, we do not have our grades posted. Confusing lectures.

Biggest waste of money if you want to learn something. Watched 9 movies in class that took the entire class lecture period, i could have stayed home and watched them all on netflix. Doesn't come prepared or know when her own exams are. Spent $100 on three text books and never used them once.

Julia is an excellent lecturer. I got an A and I didn't study at all for any of the exams because I remembered every word that she said during lecture, because it was all SO interesting. If you go to class regularly, you don't need to do the readings (she goes over them) and you'll do well. If you don't go, it'll be much harder to do well.

she assigns reading every night (never once opened the books..). pay attention to key points, it's self explanatory. takes attendance every day but only 5% of grade. every tues there would be a MC quiz over the previous 2 lecture's material.. very simple, with extra credit if you wrote extra info next to your answers. papers inclu. 4 midterm&final

I am an in education so this class was a stretch. The material is extremely interesting,so much better than I had anticipated. She is also normal and so nice, unlike what one might picture a classics teacher. She goes over most readings in lecture. Tests/quizzes are easy if you pay attention;Use study guide. I would recommend this class to anyone.

I absolutely LOVED this class! Prof H is absolutely an incredible professor. She makes the class enjoyable, while at the same time introducing concepts I had never thought of before. I thought the class was very relatable - I'm a pre-vet student and I learned new information that I will use in the future. I looked forward to class. Exams are fair

Prof H really made this class interesting. Every class period she had a new modern discovery tied into the topic discussed that day and made the class enjoyable to attend. Knows what she is teaching well and offers a TON of extra credit opportunities! Loved the class and highly recommend it.

She is awesome! Totally changed the way that I am approaching my plans for med school. So much makes so much more sense now. Anyone thinking of health sciences (or any science really) needs to take this class. Nelson-Hawkins is one of the absolute best!
Loved Professor Hawkins! This was a very informative class and she was also able to make it interesting. I truly believe she wanted us to do well in her class.

I took this class out of curiosity-beyond glad I did. As a seasoned medical professional I found this class not only fascinating on a classics literature/historical level but from medical perspective as well. Exceptional teaching/lecture material. HIGHLY recommend class/professor. I will certainly be pursuing further education in this department.

This class was a lot of fun. The instructor knew a lot about the material and kept the class interesting. She also found a way to incorporate watching 28 Days Later into the course, which was pretty awesome. Those criticizing her need to remember she is an expert in classics, not medicine, and she did a great job teaching a medicine based course.

The professor was very passionate and made me love the course. Also offered help, and wanted class participation. I felt other students really gave her a hard time, even when she asked to be corrected if she was wrong. It was really unfair to her. But I thought she really helped us to understand the material of the course, and wanted us to pass.

Repeatedly strayed out of the scope of the course and stated facts not in her field.  Some of what she said pertained to my area of study and was incorrect, which made me question what else she said was incorrect.

Easy class, Julia makes the class amazing. She made game of thrones references at least twice a week. Attendance of lectures is not mandatory though I recommend it. She explains the text well and makes class fun. My advice: read the books, it helps you with interpreting the texts for the final.
Easy fun and educational.  Classics course but don't remember what number it was. Strongly recommend.
The class was easy. Translation and discussion of the historical writings of authors. There is not much else to say.

This Professor is the worst I have ever taken. This class ruined my entire semester. Impossible to answer any question correctly because he has very strong and specific opinions. If you write about anything he doesn't agree with, will get a bad grade. No one in the class got a 100 on any test. Took a 2000-level class and he taught like it was 6000.
It is a difficult class. The TA that I had was helpful,. Two papers and two exams. Hard grader.

Harril's knowledge over religionChristianity is impressive. He knows everything about the bible and other historic pieces of literature. His classes are hard but if you want to learn about religion..I recommend him as a teacher.

Tests were pretty okay. Papers are graded incredibly rough. Papers are graded on his opinions. If you are a Christian, this class challenges your faith a lot. I would highly recommend to anyone to not take this course. The professor contradicts himself and refuses to answer challenging questions. Hated the course in all aspects.

Collin was a clearly passionate and funny lecturer. Assignments were simple and easy to follow. I wish the course was a bit more consistent in terms of when things were released, but there was always enough time to watch the lectures and take the quizzes.

Class was very easy. Almost every question on every exam and quiz came right off the power point and there was more than enough time to look at the slides to get good grades on the assignment. Prof Parks was very flexible with me as I dealt with being hospitalized and couldn't deal with course work for weeks. Overall a great course.

The class itself was straight forward and pretty easy however, I had a family situation occur and he was not accommodating nor compassionate about what was happening. I had to fly out to LA to see my brother in the hospital and he responded that he hoped my friend felt better and to complete the assignment by the end of the week.

Class was very easy and pretty straight forward. Almost every question from quizzes or exams were pulled directly from the lecture slides he posted. Lectures and assignments sometimes came up late but the deadlines were always adjusted to accommodate any changes. Easy A

Very knowledgeable and passionate about the topic and includes some jokes in his lectures to keep things interesting, which is great. All of the quizzes and exams were very easy and straight from the presentations. Lectures and assignments were often uploaded late, but he usually moved deadlines to accommodate for that.

3 total grades for the class, only one was graded before the last day of classes. Failed to stay on topic and didn't make the subject interesting. Doesn't elaborate his standards. Funny guy, but not great at teaching. Worst class I have taken so far.

He is a great professor! The class is only graded on a couple things, so make sure to go over his slideshows before the quizzes. He is a very chill professor and is very accommodating, especially with all the covid protocols. I would 100% take another class with him.

Blume is a funny guy, who gave good lectures on a topic that really wasn't that interesting. Class was made up of quizzes and two tests that were not difficult if you went to class. Recommend taking one of his courses, would be interested in taking another myself.

Professor Blume is an amazing instructor. Super knowledgeable and passionate about Roman Civilization. Class was always interesting and always on topic. He is the perfect professor for this class and I wish I could take it again because hes just that great. Hes also just an all around bro and is super chill while remaining serious. 10/10 epic guy

Professor Blume is honestly one of the best classics professors Ive had! Hes very fair with grading and offers plenty of extra credit. Having taken his class, I would highly recommend it. Reading is heavy, but the books are interesting reads so nothing too boring. Also grading is based off one essay and two exams. Would definitely take again.
This man is fairly funny but honestly is kind of a jerk too. At least he puts things bluntly though. Im always so excited when he cancels class though, best part of my day.

Hank might not be the greatest professor in terms of teaching, but he makes up for it with charm, care for his students, and depth of knowledge of the subject. If you put in the minimal effort for this class you will come out with an A; just make sure you at least go to class if you don't read the books. One of my favorite classes and lecturers.

This class was very deceiving. I was under the impression that if you just showed up to lecture and gave a little bit of effort that this class would be passable. However, for a 3 credit class that people probably are only taking for GE credit, it requires a lot more work than what I would consider ideal. There are better options, trust me

Couldn't disagree more with whoever wrote the last review. There is a lot of reading in the class, but spark notes/lectures are just fine. Hank is so thorough with context/main ideas from readings. We had a response paper (easy), a midterm (easy) and have a group work final. Not to mention he's precious and hilarious.

The WORST class I have ever taken. I only took him because of the reviews on here, BIG MISTAKE! There is A LOT of reading and your grade is only based off of like four things so if you do poorly on one of them youll most likely end up with a poor grade.
Taught us how atomic bombs work r8 8/8 gr8

Take his class!! Easy A!! 3 papers a semester, 1 page MAX double spaced. I never read a single book and still got an A on every midterm. Offers extra credit after each midterm. You're graded on few assignments, but they're easy. He's also funny and tries to make a classical literature class as fun as it can be

Hank is a super cool guy, but very unorganized. He's really slow about putting grades in and his TAs grade tough! Def not an easy A and requires work, however if you attend lecture regularly you should be good to go! Hank is really good about not making lecture boring, and he's hot which is a plus

Hilarious, interesting guy. His lectures aren't incredible but he does a great job summarizing the material we had to read. The class itself is easy but having Hank as a professor made it far more enjoyable than it would have been.

Here's the thing, Hank is the bomb dot com, but the class isn't easy peasy lemon squeezy. So get ready to read about 4 books and an online story, or be able to use spark notes. The last 2 books for the final are not on there though, you have been warned. He is funny, and wants all of his students to succeed. Great guy!!

Honestly the love of my life. He is an incredible professor - best I've ever had. He's so smart and passionate with what he is talking about. Minimal papers but not hard to write at all. Great class, great professor. Absolutely recommend taking this class!!!

Hank is the bomb. Great guy and really personable. His class is a couple of essays (one page long) and 3 exams. show up and pay attention and you won't have to read the books. The TA's can be a little tough on grading so be careful. For the final we created a google doc and shared our notes(with his permission). Best professor ever!!

Hank is an exceptional professor who connects well with students. He seems to understand the material very well and makes it easy to understand. Also, he is laid back and doesn't act like he is better than all the students.

He takes random attendance throughout the semester, not any specific day. Some of the books that are read, the lectures need to be attended to get a good grade. There are some papers that are not hard to write and are short. It is a ton of reading, though and the exams can be somewhat hard.
Hank is a really nice guy who makes Latin fun!
Random attendance checks throughout semester for participation points, 3 exams and short papers. Understand the books; overall not too bad.

Unlike his name suggests, Hank Blume is actually young, super funny and a little awkward. He does a nice job of presenting his material and definitely seems to know what he is talking about. The intro class has a lot of reading, but if you just go to class and take notes you honestly can still get an A.

Be prepared for a class of reading at a fast pace and writing papers. There were five papers, and two midterms. The midterms weren't difficult if you do the reading. I'd recommend you read most of the books, but you can skip one or two and cliff note it if you're busy.

Take notes in class and keep them! They will be very helpful for your final exam. Lots of reading, but all discussed in class and makes it all easy to understand. Easy to talk to and engage with. Essays are seven pages long, double-spaced- seems like a lot but isn't too bad. The more feedback from your outline you use, the higher grade on essay.

I loved Prof Jusdanis. His lecture's were hard to stay awake through, but I could tell he really loved his job. He's very passionate about his profession and loves his students as well. Get ready to read a whole lot. If you aren't one to read books, I bid you good luck.
What a fantastic professor! I took this as a GE, but it was my favorite class of this semester! He's so passionate and engaging and his class was very easy to succeed in!

I loved this class, specifically because of the professor! I just took it for a GE, but it ended up being my most enjoyed class. He is clearly passionate about what he teaches. He does grade based on participation (but it's easy), so you have to go to class for those points but i never felt like he gave me an unfair grade & assignments were easy.

An incredibly compelling and passionate man. The readings in the class can be difficult to understand, but he always takes time to clarify anything the class does not understand. He was flexible when I had to miss class. Available outside of class almost all of the time. Go into this class with your best effort and you will do well.
His lectures are extremely boring!! Just reading his powerpoints before exams will be fine for a good grade. He makes you do 4 one page papers that are very easy.

So the TAs mainly do the grading for this class, but there's only 4 papers to write, but don't be shocked if you get 9.5/10 on almost all of them. The tests are super easy IF YOU READ!! you cannot get an A without reading all the readings and they'll be hard to sparknote, but some can be found.
Greg is the best! He grades essays really easy. The class is very interesting and engaging, and he is one of my favorite professors!

Prof. Jusdanis is a real bro. He was always super kind and caring, and his passion for his subject definitely shows. He is an able teacher, and helps you get excited about stuff you might not care about. There was quite a bit of reading to do at times but it's college, so do the reading and you'll get an A.

Excellent lectures. Prof. Jusdanis is very passionate in his field. Although I'm not majoring in Classics, his passion and genuine care for students encouraged me to come to his lectures and read the assigned textbooks. Would definitely recommend one of his classes. One of OSU's finest professors, without a doubt.

An awesome professor. I didn't have any interest in the subject matter, but his teaching style and passion for it made me want to come to class. There is a lot of reading, but doing it pays off. Exams are essentially extended reading comprehension tests, so reading the book results in an easy A. Essays are slightly more strictly graded, but not bad

Probably the best professor I've had at this university. His stories are very engaging and he is very genuine. There was quite a bit of reading in his class, but it is completely doable. I was looking at a B for my final grade in his class, but he allowed me to write a two-page paper to bump it up to an A. Take this guy if you have the chance.

Prof. Jusdanis is great, he's very friendly and welcoming and genuinely wants his students to enjoy his class. He's not too tough of a grader and will give specific feedback about what you could do better.

He was a great Intro to Classic Lit prof. Very passionate about the subject matter and tried to get students equally interested. Picked good reading material and exams are very easy (one short essay and a few "pick 4 of the 10 options and talk about them" sections. Essay assignments may be tricky for worse writers, but overall an enjoyable class.

Lectures are unnecessary to go to, but are somewhat enjoyable. Read the books, go over the slides and you'll do well. Essays are graded easily. Exam essays given in advance. You get to pick from a selection of short answer questions. Seems to care about students.

I really don't know how I feel about him. He didn't assign us long papers but was unnecessarily nit picky about grading. Lots of reading that I mostly didn't do and was fine. Couple class presentations we had to do but they were short. He likes participation and likes to talk about himself

Mod Greed Lit. TOUGH grader. You have to write 7 page papers. SO you have to try really hard. You READ 5 books! You have to memorize every single thing you've read, text, author, titles, etc for the final. YOU WILL READ A LOT. Classes are boring he just makes you read aloud then he reads right after what you just read. POINTLESS.

After a semester I can't really say how I feel about Professor Jusdanis. I know he is very excited about his own work, however, it comes off conceited at points. I was having trouble with a paper, so I went to office hours, and after he said he would have time to read a paper, he refused to spend more than ten minutes. There was over an hour left.

He does assign a lot of readings, but he's super approachable, friendly, and passionate about his works. He is an endearing man who I have really enjoyed class with. As a world lit major, I enjoy reading so it wasn't too hard of a class for me.
A very entertaining class, though it involved TONS of reading.  Jusdanis is a great guy, once you get used to his quirks and sense of humor.
Tough grader who expects a lot of effort, perhaps a little too much considering the low grades he hands out on papers. Intelligent and often funny. Overall, he teaches a very interesting class.

This is a class you have to know you will be interested in before you sign up, or you will be bored to tears.  I was interested and, in my opinion, he tackled such a seeminly impossibly broad subject very well.  Papers assignments were broad, but that's the point.  On top of that, he was just a pleasure to wake up to in the morning, great guy.

Nice guy, but this class will make you want to kill yourself of boredom.  I get the feeling he did not prepare any kind of lecture whatsoever, so everyone just talks and you end up having no idea what any of the 40,000 reading assignments meant.  This will be your most expensive class by far as he couldnt be bothered to put anything on e reserve.

10 weeks is way too long to talk about Nationalism. I really looked forward to the class but by the time we got to week five it became a chore and the discussions seemed repetitive. Grades consisted of two seven+ page papers and a final based on a ton of reading. Jusdanis is a great guy, but he couldnt keep me interested in the material.

Prof. Jusdanis requires hard work but I found that most of my class respected him and was willing to put in the necessary work.  This was also a course outside of his traditional discipline, so I suppose it would be interesting for me to take one of his lit courses.

The class is not too hard.  Two papers and a final.  It is a lot of reading though.  He also has the harshest attendance system I've ever seen.  You get 2% of your final grade for EVERY class you miss.
I thought this class wasn't going to be bad so I took it as a GEC, but we ended up with a lot of reading, having to write two papers, taking a huge final, and the class had mandatory participation.

(MU, NJ) Nothing but good words for Professor Lipp. He's got great energy and in terms of teaching, puts forth more effort for his students than most of my previous professors combined. His books are cost-friendly, and be prepared to use them. I honestly imagine you could only do poorly in Lipp's class if you simply refuse to interact with others.

Professor Lipp is a very nice person however as a Professor his class just wasn't challenging, and it didn't feel like a history class. A lot of people appreciate his approach but I can't get behind it, I prefer my history classes to talk about history. He solely grades on attendance, so beware if you are lazy like me.

Best 8:30 class ever. No better way to start an early morning class than with this wonderful man's outlook and optimism on the world. Was actually kind of sad that the class ended. I would love to see this man on the Joe Rogan podcast or at least get a drink with him sometime. This guy was like a Jedi Master. (Taken at Monmouth University, NJ)

Dr. Lipp has been my favorite professor at OSU by far. He makes his lectures interesting and funny. Papers are only one page and he offers to read it before you turn it in and give feedback so you're guaranteed an A. As long as you pay attention in lectures you'll get 100% on all the online quizzes. I would recommend his class to everyone!
His lectures are amazing! I havent read any of the books and still did well in his class. Definitely my favorite prof at osu.

Took this class to complete a GE but soon found out that this class was much more than that. Dr. Lipp cares a lot about this subject and teaches it in a way that can impact your life. He does an amazing job connecting ancient works to today's world and really makes you think about things differently. Online quizzes and papers are a breeze.

Dr. Lipp was an awesome professor. His lectures are informative and interesting. Your grade is made up by 10 quizzes (online so open note) and 3 papers (1 page each) so NO EXAMS! If you know some basic greek myths this should be a very easy A. I didn'tt even read the assigned text and did fine.

Dr. Lipp is a great professor who is very clear on what he expects of his students. He has very fun and thought provoking lectures. The reading can be tedious at times but if you keep up with the text his lectures and class become so much easier. Very easy grading system.

Dr. Lipp explains the readings so well in lectures that you probably don't even have to read outside of class. If you take good notes, then you can do well on the weekly quizzes. These weekly quizzes are worth a huge bulk of your grade and the lowest quiz grade is dropped. These quizzes plus 3 one-page papers make up your total grade. No exams.

Probably an easy A if you read the novels he assigns (66% of grade based on 12 quizzes about themes discussed IN LECTURE & comparison of characters), but as a premed taking 18 credits, I have other priorities so it's my own fault. I have a B and stopped going to lecture after week 3 or 4. Also turned in a paper late (I hate writin) I recommend Lipp
Not many grades in overall, and 66% of the overall consists of online quizzes. Make sure you remember to take them, if not it will hurt your grade.

Dr. Lipp was very clear in what material he wanted you to know. I went to every lecture and took good notes and never needed the books. He is a bit full of himself, but he is entertaining. Attend lecture and you'll do fine. He announces bonus during lecture to make people attend. I would definitely recommend taking him and Classical Mythology.

Lectures could sometimes put you to sleep but over all probably easiest class I've taken.   He tells you exactly what you need to know for quizzes. Also his papers are only a page long, can be tough to get all you want to say in a paper, but a very low stress class if thats what you need.

I appreciated learning from the perspective of this professor.  He made the material come to life, such that I could understand and appreciate the material on a much deeper level than what I got from just reading the texts on my own. Warning: it's a ton of dense reading for a non-major class; the TA's are tough graders, so work hard on the essays!

Dr. Lipp is so passionate about the novels that he teaches and he made me look at them in a way that I didn't expect. I would absolutely take another class with this professor. He seems like an all-around good person and he made me enjoy classic novels, something that I was never really interested in experiencing before this class.
Very entertaining lecturer. You must read the books then the class is a breeze.

Dr. Lipp was a great professor for Classical Mythology.  He was so passionate about the subject, and he was also really funny.  I liked how much he connected with the class, and I think the class really respected him.  His quizzes were really easy, but the essays required you to have read the books and gone to lecture.

I loved Dr. Lipp's class! I didn't have a lot of background in the course, but he was enthusiastic to help the class understand the background material. If you won't read the books, don't take this course. The papers you write are dependent on the in-course readings. I found the readings very interesting, though. Class discussion is very helpful!

Professor Lipp took over my mythology class when our other professor had to go on medical leave. He is a wonderful teacher! You HAVE to go to lecture to do well in the class, but if you go to lecture it will be an easy A. The only grades are online quizzes every week and three one page essays. Take this class, I highly highly recommend it!!!!

This professor needs to teach a different class, preferably one where he knows what he's teaching and doesn't just talk about the same reading over and over. Been in class over a month and each assignment has had to do with the same reading. I'm learning nothing and philosophy is getting ruined.

By far one of the worst professors I have had the displeasure of having. He rambles and cannot communicate information or ideas clearly, he is not an artist nor is he a philosopher, he is violently incompetent at digital communication, and he answers questions with questions. He never replies to emails and randomly changes due dates.

Dr. Fletcher was a very tedious and long lecturer. He typically went much too in depth and philosophical in the myths, and was too difficult to follow. The quizzes aren't that easy, and you have to go to lecture to pass them. He can be quite funny at times, but the time in class is better spent actually doing the readings.

He made mythology pretty interesting. Going to lecture several times a week got old very quickly though, because of my lack of interest in the subject matter. If you go to lectures you get information for the last 3 questions on his weekly 10-question quiz. In order to pass all you have to do is know the stories somewhat well and write a few papers

Worst professor ever, the quizzes were really a lot harder than with other professors. His accent is annoying. 0-10 do not recommend. you literally have to go to every class or you will miss 3 questions on every quiz

Okay so let's start with the fact that Prof Fletcher is a hilarious British man, so showing up to lectures is great just to hear him talk. He is super helpful if you have questions, and he loves to just talk about mythology and philosophy; which I found entertaining. Easy A, just pay attention and read. Helps that I think he's kinda cute lol.

This class is pretty decent if you need a literature GE. That being said, the lectures are interesting, but kind of hard to understand. Prof. Fletcher kind of gets philosophical about myths and I don't ever really know what he is talking about. If you skim the reading and attend the lecture you will be more than fine.

Dr. Fletcher expects you to make this GE course the center of your priorities and punishes the class for a lack of attendance (even though it isn't required) by not posting the lecture slides.  He moves too quick through everything and is difficult to understand.
Good professor but the lectures weren't the most interesting but a lot of material from the quizzes you'd only know if you attended. Read and attend most lectures and you'll do fine.
The topics became really uninteresting as the semester went, but as long as you did well on the online quizzes you got a high grade. Lots of reading!! But on the bright side, no final!

Not always the most interesting material but he made the lectures more interesting and there was material on the quizzes you could only get from going to lecture. Make sure you read the books. I recommend him!
Loves to lecture. Just show up and the class is easy.

Most of the material was review for me, but Fletcher made it interesting, and the grading system is easy if you remember to take the quizzes each week. Quizzes were online this semester, which meant that you could just google the answers if you didn't know them. Lectures weren't mandatory, but he had certain slides that you only get at lecture

I think Fletcher is on to something with is class model / structure. It's certainly not perfect, but it is interest. Personally, the lectures were incredibly boring, i could not help but fall asleep, i'm not sure if it was his accent, or speaking but i couldnt listen/ comprehend what he said. Quizzes were easy IF you read, papers not bad.

Great teacher and he was very funny! Attendance isn't mandatory for lecture but it is for recitation.  No Midterm or final, just weekly 10 point quizes and 3 papers. Very easy class and interesting for the most part. Easy A class if you take the time to read the material.

The grade for this class consisted of three papers and weekly recitation quizzes. Even though you could probably get by with not going to class, Prof. Fletcher was hilarious (and I loved hi British accent). I would definitely recommend this professor.

Interesting class. Huge lecture so only recitation attendance was mandatory. Quizzes are easy points as long as you read (which usually isn't bad) and pay attention when he gives answers in class. Towards end of semester there were lots of bonus opportunities. He has a good sense of humor. Content can be really interesting. Overall great class.

This is the class to take if you need either a Literature or Global Studies GE. 13 quizzes (one dropped), three slightly difficult papers, and attendance credit. He also gives an extra credit quiz at the end. He gave the content, what I thought was hard to hunderstand, clarity and meaning. Take the class!

Weekly quizzes are pretty easy and they are a good opportunity for points. Had to do a lot of reading, but there aren't any midterms. Okay way to get your GE credit. Oh, and his sexy British accent is pretty awesome.

Richard is awesome! He is very helpful and gives detailed power points. He is obviously extremely knowledgable about mythology. He has an accent which makes the class all the more fun. Richard also seems to genuinely care about teaching and his students. TAKE HIS CLASS
His lectures werent the most interesting, but theres no midterm or final so that made up for that

While I took 222, it is now 2220. His accent makes class enjoyable, it is interesting, too. Go to class though, the info is quizzable and not on Carmen. There were ten 5 pt quizzes (lowest dropped). There were three papers, worth 5, 10 & 15 pts. Class was out of 100, with recitation mandatory & worth 25 pts. Easy 5 pt ex cred paper. Awesome class

This is a great class,especially if you like mythology. Fletcher is super friendly, doesn't lecture on fridays, and gives no midterm or final. And he has a British accent so he's fun to listen to. Assignments include nightly reading, weekly multiple choice quizzes and 3 papers. Great class, I enjoyed it a lot.
Great Lecturer.  Keeps the content interesting and the class easy.

Enthusiastic, knowledgeable lecturer. Weekly quizzes, three papers. Tends to run over, don't schedule anything immediately afterward. If you go to lecture, you should be able to answer all the quiz questions. He also gives a lot of clues on what he wants to see in the papers at lecture. Reading not overly burdensome, but sometimes dull, Plato esp.

I personally love mythology so I loved this class, however in lectures he runs overtime everyday and can ramble a lot. However the quizzes are easy, there are no midterms or final and only three papers to write. Interesting class only if you like mythology. Also lots of reading each night to do.

Five papers, but you can email them to him ahead of time and he'll tell you exactly what to fix before grading. A lot of the grade is participation, so show up (even though it sometimes feels like forever) and talk once in a while. Great guy!

Painfully knowledgable about his subject, so lectures can be either really boring or informative, depending on your level of interest. However, the 4 papers and the project were straightforward and were not graded harshly at all. You would pretty much have to try not to do well in this class. Very friendly and extremely helpful. Highly recommended.

PP slides that he puts up on Carmen, 4 3pg papers, one 7pg final paper, no quizzes. He essentially tells you what he wants to see in each paper, so there is no excuse to not get an A in this class. Lectures go extremely slow, however.

Dr Fletcher is a really brilliant man, but he can't communicate clearly and often goes much more in depth than is required. Lecture is not helpful, but he gets offended if you don't go. Do the readings and show up for lecture with something else to keep you occupied.

Classics222.Attendance required.10 quizzes, drop lowest 1.3 papers (he says is new this quarter).No midterms/finals.If you already have ANY knowledge of mythology, you'll do fine. If you have time, read the lecture PPTs; they help! Take Fletcher for recitation b/c he gives you nearly all the answers to the quiz during discussions (he writes them!).

he is a good teacher. he makes the class a lot harder than some other teachers. he has a lot of reading, and the myth class stuff is kinda is a pain. if i had to do it again i would take one of the other teachers. all and all he isnt bad and really cares about the subject, maybe a little too much.
good teacher who uses powerpoint slides and wants his students to succeed would take again

english accent is the best. he loves classics but lectures go really fast. my t.a. made this class easier, but there is a ton of reading involved if your t.a. is crappy.(justin hanson is good) take this class with someone because every lecture has a "myth flash" which is not in the online slides, but is on the weekly quiz.
Fletcher is pretty good, he posts his slides which help out a lot.  There is a lot of reading involved, not too bad of a class.  Easy to get an A if you put in the time.
One of the best teachers I've had.
He knows his stuff, adapts well to the students, but his lectures are sometimes quite boring
No Comments

The notes make things easy to study for, and he gives you enough choice on the tests that you should be able to do well. He really knows his stuff, and he's great to talk to after class. A bit disheveled and disorganized, Fletcher seems like the absent-minded professor cliche. Quizzes do require you to do the reading, but the readings aren't bad.

I would 100% recommend taking any of scotts classes he is very understanding and makes sure that all of his students want to learn and is very entertaining to listen to and hilarious, loved his class!
Scott was my favorite prof this semester. He cares a lot about you and has mutual respect. He is very detailed and has story telling based lectures, making it easy to listen and follow along.

He is honestly the best professor here at OSU Marion. He actually has social skills unlike some of the other professors, he actually cares about you and your academics, and he is very charismatic and genuinely kind-hearted. His class was very fun and easy, and if you just listen to what he has to offer in his lectures, you'll do great.

Mr. Fisher genuinely cares about you and your education. While attendence is not mandatory I would highly recommend showing up to his classes. You will learn a lot more than just classics. In recent years his classes have become a bit more difficult, as OSU pressures him to use more concrete testing formats. His projects are interesting and simple.
He is a great guy and really cares about helping you get a good grade. One of the best people I've met!

I'm surprised the school allows him to grade the way he does, i.e., quizzes, etc., are all open-book (or internet, or classmates, etc), but it actually works. I think most people actually retain most of the information, despite not really having to to do well in the course. I think it comes down to his personality and teaching style. It just works.

I found that his class was not only easy but I retained more knowledge than any other class. You will have no trouble showing up to Scott's classes bc they are interesting and entertaining. Best Class ever:)
No Comments

He is a funny guy who enjoys teaching. His class is fun. 20 essay questions, usually 12-15 are take home and the rest you work in class with group. You watch some movies. I enjoyed taking this class and you only use the book for tests. Highly recommended!

this guy is awesome, he really knows his stuff and loves life and what he's teaching.  He really doesn't believe in stand. testing, so all tests are group/take home/easy/fun.  Take this class!!!  Prof. Fisher has a GREAT personaity and is a great guy, so give his classes a chance! gl

A very, very standoffish professor. His welcome video was basically him saying how he doesn't get paid enough and how even though one of the 6 quizzes will be dropped, "you WILL do all six". Beyond that, nice dude. Gave good feedback on analysis and other papers. Doesn't grade super heavy.

Papers are extremely difficult to write based on the lack of instructions that he gives. This professor is lazy and will not put any grades in for months at a time so you never really know what your grade is. The only reason I would take this class again is because he is so lazy that he sometimes just puts 100's in for everyone.
Great teacher overall. The class consists of two exams and one paper.

Dr. Green knows his stuff and is a solid lecturer. If you ask for feedback on your paper, he will go above and beyond. Before you take Ancient Roman Classics, just know that it is a lot of reading classics and not a lot of learning about culture.
I went to the mandatory amount of lectures and passed this course with 100%. Going to the lectures was nice, when I did, because she truly is passionate.

The class was interesting. She sometimes struggled to get her point across and rambled here and there but overall she was very kind and the information was usually interesting. The class is not hard in the slightest. Just show up to the lectures and listen and you'll be just fine. She also posts the lectures so if you miss you can go back and watch

Professor Carolina Lopez-Ruiz is a considerate instructor, but she may have trouble explaining her ideas to audiences, especially in this course that have many weir terms. However, she is working hard to improve this and every students can feel it. Nicely organized course and should be your choice if you having trouble deciding which GE to choose.

Great GPA booster. Two attempts on weekly quizzes. Weekly participation is one simple question. Three quick essays. Final exam is optional. She wrote the textbook and definitely knows her stuff so if you're interested in the material you will learn from her as well.

The class is very easy. You only need to participate 12 times and you can say goodbye to lectures. The weekly quizzes are very simple and you can look at the slides to find the information quickly. The 3 papers we had to write were easy topics and they do not grade them heavily at all.

Super easy course. Grade is based off of participation points (which you can earn during class or outside of it,) ten point quizzes (which you get two attempts on, and they're open note,) and three short essays. Definitely a GPA booster with only a small amount of effort.

I personally was not a big fan of Carolina. Although the class just wasn't my taste, her lectures were a huge snooze fest and I rarely felt inspired to participate. There was always readings to be done, and hard work never paid off. This class will have you doubting if you're going to pass or not. I wouldn't say she's horrible, but she'snot for me.

Great class. While there is a required textbook, just showing up to class covers everything you need to know for the quizzes. Papers are short, not challenging, and fun. No final exam if you do well on the open note quizzes. Attendance is not mandatory, but it is definitely worth it to attend and participate.
Just use the powerpoints that she uses to take little bit of notes. It will help you with the online quizzes. 2 relatively easy paper.
Look at the online powerpoints and take the online quizzes and you will pass.

She was great seriously and so were her TAs she is one of the nicest professors you will ever meet. I still learned a lot from her and shes so enthusiastic about what she teaches. Her book was actually really good which I wasnt expecting going in. Go to class, do the readings, and write a fun but good essay and youll be fine.

super easy A. If you're looking for a grade booster - here's your class. You definitely don't have to go to class but if you are really interested in the subject she's very passionate about it and it's pretty interesting. You don't need the book but it really helped to have it when writing the essays (2 short, easy essays - I got 100s on both)

One of the easiest classes I have ever taken. You can put a lot of work into the class and really dive into the mythology and how it is connected. (She literally wrote the textbook the class uses.) Or, you can not show up to class, and take the online, open note quizzes using the lecture slides she posts and still get an A.

In high school, I took combined English/World Civilizations classes and had to read mythology every day. We read most of the texts that we are reading in this class but I actually enjoy it this time around. She is such a great professor and takes a more well-rounded approach to classics. Take her! She's very knowledgeable and enthusiastic to teach!

literally showed up the first day and not once again and got a 99.5% in the class. No exams ever. 5 pt online quiz every week and no final if you average above A- and you get two attempts on the quiz. Highly recommended grade booster easy professor but her accent is very thick so couldnt understand her when she used a microphone anyways

hardly showed up to class, and still passed (with an A!) read the powerpoints online, and you'll pass the class easy. not great if you're actually hoping to learn about greek mythology, great if you dont care about your GEs.

One quizz per week. There are 14 quizzes and she will drop 2 (lowest ones). She is funny on her own way. Very caring when it comes to assisting students. There's also 2 short essays. You get to re-submit the 1st one. All quizzes are online and there are 2 attempts. Final (Online) is optional if your average is over 90%. Def fun and interesting.

This class was pretty straightforward. There were weekly quizzes that went along with the lecture notes. She was passionate about the material and understanding as a professor. The class was decently interesting even for someone who isn't a huge fan of mythology.

Very easy A. Attendance is not mandatory nor suggested; she talks very quietly and it can be very difficult to hear and understand her. Simply review the PowerPoints she posts online before the online quizzes and you should be good to go!

There are no exams in this class at all.  Just weekly quizzes which consist of questions pulled directly from the powerpoints on Carmen and 6 one page essays which are super easy.
