I didn't go to class after the 1st month or even do the reading and got an A.  Just read the powerpoints before the quizzes (only takes 10 minutes to read through them).

Easy stuff. Show up to class and just listen. She also gives you power points. There are weekly quizzes on Carmen and 6 short 1 page essays. You get to drop 2 quiz grades and 1 essay. Only thing is there was a lot more near eastern myth than I was expecting because she specializes in comparative mythology.

She's passionate but hard to understand sometimes. She explains things in a very abstract way but is also a very easy teacher. Super nice and kind but I didn't learn much. Graded by 14 quizzes which are really easy and three papers also graded easily.
Easy class, passionate professor, makes the material more engaging.

I took this class because I needed to fulfill a requirement and I have the most useless advisor known to man (I actually go to a different advisor now). The class I took is CLAS 2301. DO NOT TAKE 2301. You have 60+ pages a week of a dry reading and Lopez-ruiz is just awful. GE's should be like this ... never take 2301.

I would recommend you take this class with some friends because it will be 10x easier. There's a weekly quiz, and if you pass them with a 90% you don't have to take the final. Also had 2 essays that weren't bad at all, that's the only reason you need the book really. Super easy GE, I definitely recommend.

Class is "QUIZ HEAVY". As long as you get over 90% on all the quizzes you don't have to take the final. Easy GPA booster, just make sure you make a friend in the class so you guys can take the quizzes together and get an A. You get 2 tries on each quiz but they're extremely specific, so go through the power points and her book.

I showed up for the first couple of weeks and never went back. There are weekly quizzes on the reading that are easy as long as you read the slides beforehand. The only time i used the book was for the 2 short essays. She drops the 2 lowest quiz grades, and if your average on the quizzes is 90% or above, you don't have to take the final. EASY A!!!

CLAS2220 under Lopez-Ruis is the easiest GE I've ever taken. I showed up for lecture for the first two weeks, before deciding to never show up again. I ended the class with a 99.3%. If you're looking for an easy literature GE, you can't do better, but unfortunately I don't think the class is good for those interested in the actual material.

She is a really great professor and cares a lot about what she teaches. Her accent can be difficult to understand, but you get used to it after a while. The exams are all easy if you look over the study guides she gives you. There's also one group project and 2 short essays. The attendance policy is annoying but this class is an easy A.

Pretty easy GE literature A. I only went to class the first two weeks. Two papers, weekly quizzes and optional final if you get an A/A- on the quizzes. She says the book is required, I only suggest renting it for the two papers if you don't plan on going to class.

The best GE choice Ive ever made. She tells you the textbook is mandatory but no one in my class ever bought it and we had no problems. Only two SHORT papers, no midterm, and optional final. Weekly quizzes but theyre online so you dont even have to do the reading, just pull up her lecture slides. If youre looking for an easy a this is it

There are three exams with no final and the exams are not cumulative. There is one presentation that no one pays attention to and she gives everyone an A. She will give out extra credit and she makes study guides.
Her three exams are not cumulative and she is a super easy grader. There is no final.

You can definitely tell she is from spain. Her accent is sometimes hard to understand and also there are often spelling errors in her power points. Although I as originally interested in mythology before taking the class, because the texts were original it was a little hard to understand and became BORING. But the class is so easy. No EXAMS!!

I found her difficult to understand but the quizzes were all online and she posts the slides from class so it's is easy to do well on them. 5 one page papers that are also easy. You don't have to go to lecture to get an easy A

Her lectures were kind of difficult to understand because of her accent, but once you get used to it she is a fantastic teacher. She genuinely cares for her students, gives relatively easy grades if you put in a little effort, and has interesting lectures. I learned a lot in her class. I would take the honors version though, it's a more close feel.

12 online quizzes and 5 one page papers is your grade. You don't have to show up for lecture but if mythology peaks your interests you might enjoy it, she is a world-class scholar. Three quizzes and one paper are dropped so its not hard to do well.

Really sweet lady; clearly enthusiastic about the material. However, read straight off the PowerPoints, so I didn't bother going to class most of the time. Most of the quiz answers are right on the PowerPoints. Would recommend.
Very interesting class and an easy A. Would definitely recommend this class and teacher.

The worse easiest class. The material was so easy. never read one story and still got an A-. The worse part about the class was her and her TAs! The TAs graded one page essays like they were english professors and left rude feedback for the paper. She didnt want to be bothered with emails from students because she said thats what the TAs were for!!

Really a very sweet and kind hearted professor. And she is very very attractive. Ok ok! she is down right sexy!!! I said it!!! She is super smart, super hot and Spanish!!! What more could you ask for?

Stopped going to class 2 weeks into the semester and still got an A. The quizzes are online and if you skim through power points and the book occasionally, its not difficult to get 1010. The weekly quizzes and 6 one page papers are your whole grade - and two quizzes and one paper gets dropped. Would DEFINITELY recommend taking for an easy gen ed.

Really hard to understand, and makes the class really dry and boring. It's in a giant lecture hall, and no one really cares, so can't understand much anyways. If there's another choice for Classical Myth, take him/her.

Professor Lopez-Ruiz is extremely knowledgeable. If you do the readings and attend the lectures, you will do great in this class. It is very important to read the book for this course otherwise the weekly quizzes will be very difficult due to the number of myths covered. Don't be discouraged if the first couple of weeks' stories are rough.

She was unhelpful and she grades papers very strictly. I'm pretty confident with my English grammar and I sailed through ENG1110 but apparently she found so many faults in my essay and gave me really low grades for my papers. I had a terrible experience with her. Also, her lectures use clickers so there's no "free" attendance points.But, she's hot.

I never attended class, and still got an A. It is in a big lecture hall and nobody cared. Honestly, I don't find the material interesting but if you read her powerpoints from carmen you can EASILY get an A.
Has a strong accent but the class is easy. She knows that mythology is an interesting topic and makes the class fun

She has a strong accent but she tries. I havent picked up the book yet and im getting an A. Interesting stuff, when you can focus. Its easy to zone out in her lectures. Go anyway, the quizzes are basically things underlined in powerpoints. SHe puts everything on Carmen. NO MIDTERMS OR FINAL !

Super easy A. You don't need to read or even attend lecture, spark notes and her weekly study guides are enough. Two simple essays and quizzes straight from the study guides. She's a little hard to understand but really nice and understanding. Interesting material to learn about too. Definitely recommend.

Pretty much all of her quiz's are on the study guide if you get them offline fill them out and review you will get an A you can probally just fill them out by going to lecture and a little wikipedia/cliff notes actions easy but fair A
great teacher, flat out awesome. Take her if you have the chance she is great and youll learn alot.

Pretty easy teacher..dont really need to buy texts..just read spark notes and do the quiz study guides she posts on carmen..take the study guide to lecture and fill it in as you go. I studied the night before for quizes and got an 88 on the final..A- in the class overall. She'skinda hard to understand at first but the more you go the better it gets

Lecture is absolutely useless. It is almost impossible to understand more than 2-3 consecutive words when she speaks in a large lecture setting.  And her slides are virtually useless to help with studying. Other than that her class is very easy as long as you keep up with the readings and do your study guides that she provides, its an easy A.

She is great!  Her lectures at first may be a little hard to understand because she has an accent, but you get used to it.  She always keeps the class interesting and has humor sometimes. Very nice and basically gives out answers during lectures.

The class was very interesting and all of the readings were fun. The class discussions were very helpful and it is all you needed to succeed in the class. I would highly recommend taking this class with Carolina as she makes mythology easy and fun (plus easy A).
Easy class. Very nice professor, always willing to help. Didn't use the book much, notes were enough to get an a in the class. If you can get a class with her, do it! Easy A and enjoyable!

Easy class. Professor Lopez-Ruiz is very nice and willing to help. Quizzes and exams are easy if you just take notes. Books aren't used a lot, you could get through the class easily without them, but that won't guarantee an A. Take her if you get the chance!

do not buy books for this class. get outlines from Carmen and take notes in class and its an easy A. She might be a little hard to understand but you get used to her accent quit and its really an easy class.

Ms. Lopez Ruiz was really easy.  If you go on carmen and write the outline of your notes before class and attend class and fill in the notes, its an easy A. People say that if you read you will do good, well i bought the books and did not read at all and got an A. Dont waste your money. Just attend class and take notes and its an easy A.
Really easy. Go to class for answers to her weekly study guides which in turn are the quizzes and the midterms. Weekly quizzes, 1 midterm, 1 final. No other grades. Easy A
She is very hard to understand because of her thick accent.  But the class is fairly easy.  If you read you'll get an A.

Has a sweet spanish accent. teaches well, just have to get used to the accent though. goes over everything and revisits similarities between different texts and therefore is a great teacher in that regard. really liked her!
